alert.note: Alert for Kinney; Maverick (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 9:10PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kinney and northern Maverick Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 910 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Radar Base, or 10 miles southeast of Quemado, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eagle Pass, Spofford, Quemado, Paloma, Darling, Anacacho, Radar Base, Normandy, Fabrica, Laughlin AFB Aux Field, Siesta Acres, Elm Creek and Seco Mines. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Texas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central Texas.
